info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Pemiscot, north central Dyer, western Obion and Lake Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 445 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cottonwood Grove, or 8 miles northeast of Caruthersville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Portageville, Reelfoot Lake State Park, Tiptonville, Ridgely, Troy, Obion, Clayton, Cloverdale, Miston, Cottonwood Grove, Hornbeak, Samburg, Cat Corner, Elbridge, Jacksonville, Broadmoor, Madie, Spout Springs, Lane and Moffatt. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for southeastern Missouri...and west Tennessee.
